stepAnswer: Any angle can be expressed as the sum of a full rotation (360° or $$2\pi$$ radians) added multiple times, which brings it back to the same position.
stepTitle: Explain why there are an infinite number of angles that are coterminal to a certain angle.
answerLatex: Any angle can be expressed as the sum of a full rotation (360° or $$2\pi$$ radians) added multiple times, which brings it back to the same position.
choices: There is only one coterminal angle for each angle because it is fixed and does not change.
Every angle has exactly one coterminal angle, which is obtained by adding $$\frac{\pi}{2}$$ radians.
Any angle can be expressed as the sum of a full rotation (360° or $$2\pi$$ radians) added multiple times, which brings it back to the same position.
Coterminal angles only exist for angles less than $$90$$ degrees
